comments.commentBody:
Our family dentist did some orthodontia as well. He put braces on his top teeth to correct a space between the front ones and a "bucktooth" look, but left the slightly crooked bottom ones alone, as our son requested. We left it up to him and that's what he wanted. His teeth look great.

With our daughter, though, there was no question she would need braces. She had snaggleteeth, and several were congenitally missing. Her orthodontia took years longer than her brother's, but achieved a very good outcome as well. Recently she got an implant for her missing front tooth, and now her teeth are just right.
He has written about it twice in the NY Times - search for him by name.

This incident is the most sensitive issue in China and the main reason for all the censorship. The lights went out and hundreds if not more protesters were killed that night and it was all cleaned up by dawn. This will NEVER be forgotten and is why the government still rounds up anybody who was involved, even the 80 year old mothers who are "causing trouble" by visiting their brave children's grave sites this time of year, who were gunned down because they wanted better government.

Tom
Not that clueless know the story very well and so the analogy with Hong Kong is perhaps subtle but not that hard to see. Taiwan had the China seat on the U.N. Security Counsel and the mainland was ignored until that seems to be odd. Come Nixon and that changed. The USA today is aboard the One Country Two Systems that Taiwan and the mainland hold to and what it means is Taiwan can go its way – so long as independence is not an issue. Sound like HK until 2049? All these things will evolve, hopefully peacefully but sword rattling, now on the upswing in D.C. circles is going to be an unhappy ending unless sane leadership reappears. On the flag, watch the entry of Taiwan team at the Olympics if you can find it.

Kasich in banning abortions, proscribing Planned Parenthood, and health care for poor women.  They only want to assure a business-friendly climate in Ohio.

Congratulations to hm1342 for deep something.  The Dixiecrats who dominated the Democratic party a century ago are now Republicans who dominate the Republican party this century.  But labels are more important than facts; we all know that.
Mary, nothing you wrote is a reason prisons have been privatized.
How sad that crime rates are not now on the rise.

TheOwl is mistaken. Reading the Tenth Amendment would be instructive. Let me help you:

"The powers not delegated to the United States by the Constitution, nor prohibited by it to the States, are reserved to the States respectively, or to the people."
Mary is flat out wrong.  Mary, if you disbelieve me, show some statistics.

Sorry, Mary, I was not specific enough.  The recidivism rate can be made very small by preparing people before release through education and job training.  However, those are among the first things to get cut when legislators want to save money.

Maybe being humbled a bit leaves nothing taken for granted. Good.

This is a very unusual person, someone of the highest quality.

And of course his polar opposites exhibited themselves when they chanted.
John, perhaps our mothers are lying in proximate plots (no pun intended, sorry), worrying to each other about their meshuginah sons. I do still have my stubs from Ebbets field at least.
Spoken like an expat who enjoys the status quo for, probably, selfish reasons. I met quite a few of those in the years I was an expat in China myself.
Taiwan's population is 23.50 million while China is 1.40 billion: hardly 2%. It's not an apple to apple comparison despite the fact that they both have a Chinese population.

Comparing the potential for democracy in the PRC  with what is occurring in Taiwan is highly problematic.  A island nation of 23 million has a different slate of circumstances than the diversity (ethnic, geographic, cultural) than the 1.3 billion on the mainland.

This guy is wrong.  China is nowhere near a collapse or revolution.  Are they becoming more authoritarian under Xi? Yes, they are but the average citizen is happy enough with their lot in life and a revolution is not on the horizon.  Besides, the prospect of a completely democratic China is outrageous.  I can only imagine the candidates who would emerge and the horse trading that would ensue.  Elections, not Xi's current crackdown, will be the end of China.

Martin, one time the kids and I were ready to set out, and suddenly, there was a beautiful lynx standing on the path. (I was parked in a shady and secluded dead-end spot. A kind ranger had showed me the secondary parking place that put us much closer to the rancho compared to the larger lot; that had been on our first visit, and our daughter had run out of steam big time.)

Loved that park!

Probably because Cleveland has one.

And on this farm there was a......Best not get me started! The photos makes me think of Rancho San Antonio there near Sunnyvale, where we often took the youngters because there was a relatively smooth, flat path that our daughter could navigate and that allowed for our baby son's stroller.
The visit I'm recollecting, the chickens were out scavenging, and young Miss W hollered, "Hey, you little Buckers!"
I saw DHubby's head whip around and his jaw drop.
Swiftly intervening, I said, 'Sweetie, I thiink they;re CLUCKers.'
She replied, 'No! Listen to them! They're saying, "Buck, buck, buck!"
E-I-E-I-O.

Nice puzzle, but one should never compete with animals or children.

His reference may be to gongwen pinyin is Lóng as pronounced龙
A joke?

If you want to see what happens when you cut back regulations in the pharmaceutical industry, read the Times series on imported drugs. http://www.nytimes.com/2008/11/02/magazine/02fda-t.html

According to that series, China has no effective drug regulations. Chinese manufacturers can sell whatever they want in the free market. They set up a paper trail that is so convoluted that, when something goes wrong, the manufacturers can't be tracked down. As a result, the manufacturers have no financial incentive to follow standard safety procedures, and people have died as a result of improperly prepared Chinese heparin.

Or for a closer example, compounding pharmacies in the US are not regulated by the federal government, and after cutbacks in funding for state health departments, they're not regulated by the states either. As a result, we had the same kind of problems that the Chinese did, with for example contamination of injected steroids by the New England Compounding Center which killed at least 60 people https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_England_Compounding_Center_meningitis_...

We started out with the free market. It didn't work.

Regulations actually create jobs -- for FDA inspectors, who make sure that drugs are manufactured safely according to standard procedures. That's as important as the job of the guy who fills up vials with drugs -- contaminated drugs, in the case of the New England Compounding Center and Chinese heparin manufacturers.

The utility industry manages to survive pretty well. Utilities are considered safe investments and a source of decent jobs.  Regulation prevents the utilities from making windfall profits during cold spells in winter in the north or during heatwaves in summer in the south.
Obviously you do not know your history.  Remember the thalidomide babies and how that happened in Europe but not here in quite as dramatic a way.  We didn't have very many because of the FDA.

With higher prices, the hospitals and clinics will stock fewer of the injectables, because if they expire unused, the loss is greater.

If a pharmaceutical company can make a brand name drug for a huge profit, why should they make a generic for a smaller, but quite reasonable profit?

I think drug companies should be regulated like utilities.
I have seen the family doing what they want at the end. Regardless of the DNR . Doctor is obligated to go along with it. I don't know what the solution is, but I hope my wishes are followed!

I have seen so many, family and friends, who have faced that long road ahead, illness, lying in a bed, unable to move, not knowing where you are, who you are, and who are they!!.. I do believe God gave doctors the knowledge to help our loved ones to and  thru the "light".. I joke I have my brown bag of Rush Limbaugh pills, and do not want to end up in the position I have seen so many just "existing"/.. There has to be a better way. God gave man knowledge to heal, and also to know when enough is enough.. I do hope somewhere in my lifetime  that each and every one can have their little brown bag.. I do also hope my family doesnt have to make that choice to "pull the plug".
